title: Understanding ORDER BY
text: The ORDER BY clause is used to sort the result set in either ascending or descending order. By default, it sorts in ascending order. To sort in descending order, use the DESC keyword.

title: Understanding LIMIT
text: The LIMIT clause is used to specify the number of records to return. It is useful for pagination or when you only need a subset of the results.

title: Identify the Sorting Order
text: In the given query, how are the records sorted?

title: Determine the Number of Records
text: How many records will the query return?

hintAnswer: Records for Eve, Dave, and Carol
title: Select the Correct Records
text: Based on the sorting order and the limit, which records will be returned?
choices: Records for Eve, Dave, and Carol
Records for Alice, Bob, and Carol
Records for Bob, Carol, and Dave
Records for Alice, Bob, and Eve
